meta.name: Automate VIRAL Youtube Titles & Thumbnails Creation (FLUX.1 + Apify)

parameters.text: =You are a YouTube content strategist. The input of the request is the following content idea :  {{ $json.query }}

messageValues.message:
=Given a content idea, extract **three keyword phrases** (1‚Äì5 words each) that are: 
- Highly relevant for a YouTube search 
- Based on what people would realistically search for 
- Focused on *actions*, *techniques*, or *tools* not just literal parts of the content idea 
- Avoid abstract or vague terms that would not return good search results  

Example:  
Content Idea: "Turn a Zoom call into a viral TikTok" 
Output: 
1. "zoom to tiktok edit" 
2. "short form video from meetings"  

Return ONLY the three keyword phrases, no explanation.

parameters.text: =You are an expert in YouTube video title optimization.

parameters.content:
## How this is Working ?
**1 -** Enter your content idea in the Edit Fields node in a "raw" format. Ex : Boil Eggs Perfectly
**2 -** LLM create 3 keywords request based on the idea and Apify scrape the YTB Search
**3 -** Wait until the dataset is completed in Apify
**4 -** Retrieve Dataset from Apify, calculate approximation of CTR and filter top performing videos
**5 -** LLM analyze patterns of best performing titles and create a prompt based on it. Another LLM create 5 titles based on these criteria
**6 -** LLM analyze patterns of best performing thumbnails and create a prompt based on it. Another LLM create 1 thumbnail based on these criteria
**7 -** Return titles and thumbnail in a HTML Page


**üì∫ Youtube Video Tutorial : https://youtu.be/Upuj9Pi94g0**
**üõ†Ô∏è Need Help with Your Workflows ? https://tally.so/r/wayeqB**
**üë®‚Äçüíª¬†More Workflows : https://n8n.io/creators/nasser/**

## SETUP

**Setup Input Content Idea :** Enter Keyword Related to the niche you want. Trigger can be replaced with anything as long as you retrieve a content idea. For example : Form submission, Database entry, etc ...

If you want to change the number of keywords, update the data accordingly in the "Create Keywords" LLM Chain node ‚û°Ô∏è Structured Output Parser AND in the "YTB Search Scrape" HTTP Request Node in Body ‚û°Ô∏è JSON ‚û°Ô∏è searchQueries.
If you want to change the number of scraped videos for each keyword, update the data accordingly in the "Create Videos Dataset" HTTP Request Node in Body ‚û°Ô∏è JSON ‚û°Ô∏è maxResults.
If you want to adjust the CTR Calculation feel free to update it in the Code Node ‚û°Ô∏è Follow the Comments (after "//") to find what you're looking for.
If you want to adjust the level of virality of the videos kept for analaysis go to Filter Node ‚û°Ô∏è Value.

**Setup Output HTML Page :** You can also replace this part with any type of storage. For example : Airtable Database, Google Drive/Google Sheet, Send to an email, etc ...

**APIs :** For the following third-party integrations, replace [YOUR_API_TOKEN] with your API Token or connect your account via Client ID / Secret to your n8n instance :
- Apify : https://docs.apify.com/api/v2/getting-started 
- OpenAI : https://platform.openai.com/docs/overview (base URL : https://api.openai.com/v1) OR OpenRouter : https://openrouter.ai/docs/quickstart (base URL : https://openrouter.ai/api/v1)
- HuggingFace (FLUX.1) : https://huggingface.co/docs

parameters.jsCode:
const titles = items.map(item => item.json.title);
return [{ json: { titles } }];

parameters.html:
Thumbnail

Titles

1. {{ $json.output.title1 }}
2. {{ $json.output.title2 }}
3. {{ $json.output.title3 }}
4. {{ $json.output.title4 }}
5. {{ $json.output.title5 }}

parameters.text:
=You are an expert in YouTube thumbnail performance. Your job is to analyze why a thumbnail might be performing well and describe it precisely so a designer or AI can later recreate its essence.

You will receive:
- The subject of the video : {{ $('Content Idea').first().json.query }}
- The URL of the thumbnail image : {{ $json.thumbnailUrl }}

Your goal:
1. Analyze the thumbnail's visual elements (faces, text, colors, emotions, layout, contrast, focus, etc.)
2. Identify what makes it visually compelling or attention-grabbing
3. Relate your analysis back to the video‚Äôs subject
4. Return a structured and precise description of the thumbnail that could be reused to generate a similar performing image.

Respond only with the description. Do not add anything else.
You are an expert visual prompt engineer.

messageValues.message:
=You are an expert visual prompt engineer.

You are given several thumbnail analysis texts, each describing what made a YouTube thumbnail visually engaging and effective. 

Data for you : 
- The Content Idea : {{ $('Content Idea').first().json.query }}
- The Analysis of performing Thumbnails for this idea : {{ $json.analysis}}


Your job is to:
1. **Summarize the most common and impactful visual elements** across all analyses.
2. **Generate one precise image prompt** that captures the best-performing elements, ready to be used with an image generation model (like DALL¬∑E, Midjourney, or Stable Diffusion).
Mandatory : 
- Maximum 400 characters (including spaces and punctuations) !
- When generating the prompt text, make sure that any double quotes within the string are escaped using a backslash (\") so that the final output can be safely included in a JSON object.

üì• Input: A list of thumbnail descriptions and visual analyses.
üéØ Goal: One image prompt that includes clear guidance on:
- Subject placement and expression
- Colors and contrast
- Text style or layout (if any)
- Graphic or visual elements
- Overall layout or composition
- Mood or tone (e.g. excitement, curiosity, professionalism)

‚ö†Ô∏è Don't describe what you‚Äôre doing. Just output the final image prompt.

üìå Example output format:
A high-contrast YouTube thumbnail with a confident man on the right side, bold yellow text on the left saying "AI SECRETS", a dark tech-themed background, and digital data stream effects in the back ‚Äî cinematic lighting, 16:9 composition.

parameters.content:
## 1- Input
Enter your content idea in the Edit Fields node in a "raw" format. Ex : Boil Eggs Perfectly

## 2- Create DataSet
LLM create 3 keywords request based on the idea and Apify scrape the YTB Search

## 3 - Wait for DataSet Completion
Wait until the dataset is completed in Apify

## 4- Filter Performing Videos
Retrieve Dataset from Apify, calculate approximation of CTR and filter top performing videos

## 5- Generate Titles
LLM analyze patterns of best performing titles and create a prompt based on it. Another LLM create 5 titles based on these criteria

## 6- Generate Thumbnail
LLM analyze patterns of best performing thumbnails and create a prompt based on it. Another LLM create 1 thumbnail based on these criteria

## 7- Output
Return titles and thumbnail in a HTML Page

parameters.text:
=You are an expert in YouTube video title optimization. Here is your input : 
{{ $json.titles.join('\n') }}

messageValues.message:
=You will be given a list of YouTube video titles that ranked highly for a specific keyword or topic. For information the topic of the video is : {{ $('Content Idea').first().json.query }}
Your task is to:  
1. Analyze the title list for patterns, such as:  
- Repeating structures or formats (e.g., ‚ÄúHow to‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúTop X‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúThis Changed Everything‚Äù)  
- Use of numbers, brackets, capital letters, emotional hooks, urgency, etc.  
- Word combinations or topic angles (e.g., ‚ÄúAI Automation for Creators‚Äù vs. ‚ÄúBuild AI Tools with No Code‚Äù)  
2. Summarize what makes these titles effective (mandatory : be as precise as possible in 5-15 points). 
3. Based on your analysis, generate a prompt for another AI language model. This prompt will instruct the second model to generate new YouTube titles for the same keyword/topic, using the same high-performing structure, tone, and techniques.  

‚ö†Ô∏è Make sure the new prompt:  
- Clearly instructs the LLM to follow identified title patterns.  - Tells it to generate clickable, short, high-performing YouTube titles. 
- Avoids common spammy phrasing or clickbait that doesn‚Äôt match the original tone.  

‚úÖ Format your response like this:
PATTERN SUMMARY:
- Point 1
- Point 2
- Point 3

PROMPT:
"Create 5 YouTube video titles about [TOPIC] using the following format:
- [Insert pattern or tone summary]
- Each title should be under 60 characters, engaging, and based on the provided structure."

üì• Example Input (titles):
- 5 AI Tools That Will Replace Your Job in 2025
- The Best No-Code AI Tool You‚Äôre Not Using Yet
- I Built an AI Business with $0 (Full Tutorial)
- How to Automate Everything with AI Agents
- This Free AI Tool Blew My Mind

üß† Expected Output:
PATTERN SUMMARY:
- Uses emotional triggers like fear or curiosity (‚ÄúReplace Your Job‚Äù, ‚ÄúBlew My Mind‚Äù)
- Often includes numbers or power words (‚Äú5 Tools‚Äù, ‚ÄúBest‚Äù, ‚ÄúFree‚Äù)
- Many titles promise results or value (‚ÄúFull Tutorial‚Äù, ‚ÄúAutomate Everything‚Äù)

PROMPT:
"Create 5 YouTube video titles about AI automation tools for solo creators using this format:
- Include emotional or curiosity-based phrases
- Use numbers or power words when relevant
- Promise a clear value or benefit in the title
Each title should be under 60 characters and match the tone of the top-ranking videos."
